item.title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/demon-slayer-kimetsu-no-yaiba-the-hinokami-chronicles-2-announced

Playable at Jump Festa 2025.

Aniplex has announced Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2, the latest issue of Weekly Jump reveals. Platforms and a release date are currently unknown, but it will be playable at Jump Festa 2025, which will run from December 21 to 22 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

The story of Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 will cover everything from the Entertainment District Arc to the Hashira Training Arc.

The original Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles is available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam worldwide.

Thanks, Ryokutya2089.

item.title: ANANTA ‘Announce’ trailer, latest details and screenshots
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/ananta-announce-trailer-latest-details-and-screenshots

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

Pre-register now for the "rule-breaking" urban open-world RPG.

Publisher NetEase Games and developer Naked Rain have released the official “Announce” trailer for free-to-play urban open-world RPG ANANTA. A new website called “Scope,” which features various scenes from the game published in the style of social media posts, has also opened.

Get the latest details below.

About

In ANANTA, players take on the role of an elite Agent within the A.C.D. (Anti-Chaos Directorate) embarking on an exhilarating adventure through a world that breaks all the rules. Nova City has plunged into Chaos, from spooky paranormal phenomena to toilets racing through traffic in the streets, the game promises to offer a unique blend of humor, adventure, and mystery. Players will meet a variety of interesting characters, jump into exciting combat, solve challenges and safeguard the balance by overcoming threats to humanity, all while enjoying unparalleled freedom to traverse and discover Nova City on a journey to find out who you really are.

Immersive Urban Experience

Players can explore the authentic urban setting of Nova City, a realistic cityscape teeming with opportunities and freedom. Throughout the game, players will also encounter adventures and exploration in other interconnected cities. Whether it’s partying at the Sonic Boom Club, visiting the Whalebone Library, or experiencing the lively Eve Art Museum, there’s always something exciting to do.

Dynamic Gameplay

Combat in ANANTA is as thrilling as a kung-fu movie. Players can use their surroundings to defeat enemies and must discern between chaos and order to help the neutral and capture the evil.

Life Beyond Missions

Apart from the intense agent missions, players are encouraged to enjoy life in the city. From weekend explorations to making new friends, ANANTA offers a rich, engaging experience.

It won’t be long before aspiring Agents can experience Nova City for themselves.

ANANTA is in development for PlayStation 5, PC, iOS, and Android. A release date has yet to be announced. Pre-registration is available now via the official website.

item.title: Memories Off Sousou: Not always true launches April 10, 2025 in Japan, Asia
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/memories-off-sousou-not-always-true-launches-april-10-2025-in-japan-asia

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Super Limited Edition includes Memories Off Fan Disc Historia.

Romance visual novel Memories Off Sousou: Not always true will now launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on April 10, 2025 in Japan and Asia, MAGES. announced. The Asian version will support both Traditional Chinese and Simplified Chinese language options.

In Japan, physical standard and limited editions will be available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch, as well as a physical “super limited edition” for Switch. Pre-orders are available now.

Here are the details:

  • Standard Edition (8,580 yen)
    • A copy of the game
  • Limited Edition (12,100 yen)
    • A copy of the game
    • Slipcase
    • Art book (60 pages, A4-size)
    • Memories Off Sousou: Not always true Sound Collection (DVD-ROM) featuring mp3 and FLAC files of the game’s official soundtrack
  • Super Limited Edition (49,500 yen)
    • Everything included in the limited edition
    • Memories Off Fan Disc Historia (with special cover different from the general release)
      • Memories Off After Rain
      • Memories Off: Sore Kara Again
      • Memories Off #5 encore
      • Memories Off 6 Next Relation
      • Memories Off Yubikiri no Kioku Futari no Fuuryuuan
      • *A general release of this collection is planned for 2025.
    • “Memories Off 25th Anniversary Talk & Live Event” invitation ticket – to be held in Tokyo on May 3, 2025
    • Original character finegraph (with picture frame and serial number)
    • Memories Off 2018 to 2024 Illustration Collection (40 pages, A4-size)
    • Trading card game DIVINE CROSS promotional card (premium edition)
  • Digital Edition (8,580 yen)
    • A copy of the game
  • Digital Deluxe Edition (12,100 yen)
    • A copy of the game
    • Digital art book (60 pages)
    • Digital Sound Collection

Here is an overview of the game, via MAGES.:

About

Memories Off Sousou: Not always true is a romance visual novel in which the story changes depending on the choices you make as you read through the dialogue. The player advances through the story as protagonist Itsuki Kusumegi.

Story

Itsuki Kusumegi, a second-year high school student, has a fiancee whose face and name he does not know. He will find out who she is when he turns 17. One day, he meets Sae Sunomiya, an upperclassman at his school, and experiences the feeling of falling in love for the first time. As he talks to his childhood friend Nene Amaha about it, Itsuki tries to get closer to Sae, but Nene has always been in love with him and dislikes the fact that he has a fiancee.

As their respective feelings collide, what will the outcome of the story between these three students be…?

Cast

  • Itsuki Kusumegi (voiced by Yuuya Hirose)
  • Sae Sunomiya (voiced by Lynn)
  • Nene Amaha (voiced by Ai Kakuma)
  • Kazune Kitakata (voiced by Hitomi Sekine)
  • Forster Mary Akira (voiced by Ami Aimoto)
  • Setsuka Nakamori (voiced by Aya Yamane)
  • Itsuki Kusumegi (voiced by Yuuya Hirose)

  • Shin Inaho (voiced by Junji Majima)
  • Hikari Kurauchi (voiced by Riona Imaizumi)
  • Tsubame Minami (voiced by Haruna Ikezawa)

item.title: The King of Fighters XV DLC characters Mature and Vice launch December 12 alongside Ultimate Edition
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/the-king-of-fighters-xv-dlc-characters-mature-and-vice-launch-december-12-alongside-ultimate-edition

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Mature and Vice available as two-character set for $9.99.

SNK will release The King of Fighters XV downloadable content characters Mature and Vice as a two-character set on December 12 for $9.99. On the same date, the company will release a digital “Ultimate Edition” of the game, which includes the base game and all downloadable content for $59.99.

Get the details below.

■ Mature and Vice

  • Content Name: Downloadable content character set “Mature +  Vice”
  • Release Date: December 12, 2024
  • Price: $9.99 / €9.99 (two-character set)

Mature (voiced by Yu Shimamura)

Mature once counted herself among the Hakkesshu—eight fervent acolytes plotting the resurrection of the divine Orochi (the so-called “will of the earth”). The cruel beauty is fast and fluid in her offense, lacerating opponents with razor-sharp strikes. Her coldhearted realism is a far cry from Vice’s own personality.

Vice (voiced by Mayumi Saco)

Like Mature, Vice was once one of the Hakkesshu—loyal followers who sought to revive the dreaded Orochi. Her frail stature masks a decidedly violent ruthlessness, which comes to the fore in the way she fights: unbridled strength and brutal throws. Vice is intrigued by Iori Yagami, who carries Orochi blood in his veins.

■ Balance Adjustments for All Characters

Alongside the December 12 arrival of special downloadable content fighters Mature and Vice, the game will receive a host of balance adjustments across the board. Get ready to experience The King of Fighters XV like never before!

■ The King of Fighters XV Ultimate Edition

  • Content Name: The King of Fighters XV Ultimate Edition
  • Release Date: December 12, 2024
  • Price: $59.99 / €59.99
  • Included Content:
    • Base game
    • Team Pass 1
    • Team Pass 2
    • Fighter Pass
    • Downloadable content character set “Mature + Vice”
    • Downloadable content costume “Garou: Mark of the Wolves Terry”
    • Downloadable content costume “Classic Leona”

A new bundle featuring every single downloadable content character on the roster!

Arriving on December 12 as a digital release, the The King of Fighters XV Ultimate Edition bundles the base game with all 20 paid downloadable content characters (including the upcoming Mature and Vice) and the two downloadable content costumes—for a massive roster of 61 fighters in total!

■ Price Revisions (effective December 12, 2024)

  • Base Game
    • Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Windows 10, Steam, Epic Games Store (digital)
    • Price: $29.99 / €29.99
  • Team Pass 1
    • Price: $15.99 / €15.99
    • Included Content:
      • Downloadable content character set “Team Garou” (three downloadable content characters)
      • Downloadable content character set “Team South Town” (three downloadable content characters)
  • Team Pass 2
    • Price: $15.99/€15.99
    • Included Content:
      • Downloadable content character set “Team Awakened Orochi” (three downloadable content characters)
      • Downloadable content character set “Team Samurai” (three downloadable content characters)
  • Fighter Pass
    • Price: $15.99/€15.99

      • Downloadable content character Sylvie Paula Paula
      • Downloadable content character Najd

item.title: Kingmakers launches in Early Access in Q1 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/kingmakers-launches-in-early-access-in-q1-2025

  • PC

Medieval shooter / strategy hybrid surpasses one million wishlists.

Medieval third-person shooter / strategy game Kingmakers will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam in Q1 2025, publisher tinyBuild and developer Redemption Road Games announced. The game has achieved more than one million wishlists on Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Go back in time to a war-torn medieval era with a vast arsenal of modern weapons, change the course of history, and save the future in this epic action / strategy sandbox. Build your kingdom, grab a gun, and lead an army of thousands into massive, real-time simulated battles—solo or in cooperative play.

Key Features

  • Conquer the Past, Save the Future – You’re the last hope in a dying world. Travel back 500 years, to medieval England, in order to change the course of a bloody war and maybe, if you’re lucky, stave off the apocalypse. Can you tip the scales of history and create a new timeline?
  • Groundbreaking Medieval Simulation – Each battle you engage in runs as a fully real-time simulation with thousands of soldiers fighting at the same time. Every soldier on the battlefield is controlled by a next-gen multi-threaded AI which controls their decision-making, pathfinding, and loyalty. This, combined with a unique procedural animation system, allows Kingmakers to offer an unprecedented level of character and combat fidelity.
  • Bring Guns to a Sword Fight – How many swordsmen do you think you could take out with an AK-47? This is your chance to find out. Use assault rifles, shotguns, grenade launchers, armored SUVs, bikes, attack helos, air strikes and more to make sure the history altering goes smoothly. Put your sharpshooting skills to the test and wreak absolute havoc on the battlefield.
  • Conquer Alone or Team Up in Cooperative Play – Up to three friends can lead their own armies alongside yours, and join in on your conquest in online cooperative play. Work together to break down the enemy castle’s defenses or defend allied strongholds against hordes of opponents. Prepare for an epic medieval multiplayer experience like no other.
  • Command Your Troops in Battle – Seamlessly switch between combat and issuing orders, at any time. While the system is easy-to-learn and simple to use, the strategic possibilities are endless. Directly issue orders to the warriors or leave it up to your petty officers, allocate legions of archers, swordsmen, spearmen, and cavalry, build fortifications, and plan your next move before diving back into the fray.
